Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this problem step by step So the task is to check which cases in the event log deviate from the normative process described Let me start by understanding the normative process thoroughly First the process starts with Receive order Then Check inventory must come next If inventory is sufficient the flow is Authorize Payment Package Items Ship Order Close Order If not sufficient it goes Cancel Order then Close Order The key constraints are that Authorize Payment must come after Check Inventory and before Package Items Package Items must be after Authorization and before Shipping Shipping should only happen after Packaging and never after cancellation Close Order is always the last step

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 Sequence Receive Check Authorize Package Ship Close That seems to follow the correct flow All steps are in order no issues here So no violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Sequence Receive Check Package Authorize Ship Close Wait here the order is Package before Authorize According to the norm Authorize must come before Package So this is a violation Because they did Package Items before Authorizing Payment The norm says that Authorize Payment should only occur after Check inventory and before packaging So this case is wrong here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Sequence Receive Check Authorize Cancel Ship Close Oh here after Cancel they did Ship Order But according to the norm after Cancel the next step should be Close Order Shipping after cancellation is a violation The norm states that Ship order should only occur after packaging and never after cancellation So this case is invalid

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 Sequence Receive Check Cancel Close This seems correct The inventory check was done then canceled then closed No issues here So this is compliant

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Sequence Receive Check Authorize Ship Close Wait they skipped Packaging Items According to the norm after Authorize comes Package then Ship So if they went from Authorize directly to Ship thats a violation Because Package Items should be done before Shipping So this case is missing the Package step which is required So this is a violation

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait let me double check The norm says that after Authorize Payment comes Package Items then Ship So if a case skips Package thats a problem So Case 5 is wrong So the violating cases are 2 3 and 5 Let me check again Case 2 Package before Authorize Violation Case 3 Ship after Cancel Violation Case 5 Ship before Package Violation Case 4 is correct Case 1 is correct So the answer should be Cases 2 3 and 5
